body:
### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

There is unfortunately no easy way to return every 2nd entry of a list

Example (every parameter would be awesome):
$x = @(Server1, Server2, Server3, Server4)
$x | select [magic every 2nd]

Output:
Server 2
Server 4


Workaround:
'Server1', 'Server2', 'Server3', 'Server4' | ? { $index++ % 2 -eq 1 }


### Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

_No response_
title: Add every parameter to Select-Object
